metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10915 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libpq, the default PostgreSQL client librarywhere libpq failed to properly reset its internal state betweenconnections. If an affected version of libpq was used with "host" or"hostaddr" connection parameters from untrusted input, attackers couldbypass client-side connection security features, obtain access to higherprivileged connections or potentially cause other impact through SQLinjection, by causing the PQescape() functions to malfunction. Postgresqlversions before 10.5, 9.6.10, 9.5.14, 9.4.19, and 9.3.24 are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
libecpg6 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpq5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04').
